title: Scars and Smoke
lyrics:
Verse 1
Sunrise bleeds red over coal-dust hills, another day’s begun,
Gravel crunches under boots, chasin’ a merciless sun.
Ain’t the life I dreamed, boy, ain’t the hand I aimed to draw,
But ghosts of broken yesterdays still claw me raw.
Pre-Chorus
No preacher’s words could save me, no bottle drowns the pain,
Just me and these old scars, walkin’ through the rain.
Chorus
Scars and smoke, heart carved to stone, that’s all they think I am,
A rambler’s soul, bound to roam, with a rebel’s give-a-damn.
But deep beneath this busted shell, a spark still fights to burn,
Scratchin’ through the gates of hell, for peace I’ll never earn.
Verse 2
Highway’s a lonesome thread, gray as a miner’s grave,
Each mile a cut that memory’s blade never forgave.
Burned my bridges, paid in blood, for choices I can’t mend,
Huntin’ grace in ghost-town dust, where the lost roads end.
Pre-Chorus
No mercy in the mirror, just a boy who learned to fight,
Carvin’ truth from shattered years, under cold starlight.
Chorus
Scars and smoke, heart carved to stone, that’s all they think I am,
A rambler’s soul, bound to roam, with a rebel’s give-a-damn.
But deep beneath this busted shell, a spark still fights to burn,
Scratchin’ through the gates of hell, for peace I’ll never earn.
Bridge
They say time stitches wounds, but mine still bleed and scream,
Echoes of a daddy’s fist haunt every damn dream.
I won’t let the dark win, won’t lay down and die,
Gonna claw toward that faint light, till I touch the sky.
Chorus
Scars and smoke, heart carved to stone, that’s all they think I am,
A rambler’s soul, bound to roam, with a rebel’s give-a-damn.
But deep beneath this busted shell, a spark still fights to burn,
Scratchin’ through the gates of hell, for peace I’ll never earn.
Outro
*(Slow picking, low E drone)*
Just a flicker of peace tonight, under this lonesome moon so bright.
Scars and smoke, it’s all I’ve known,
Keep walkin’ these roads, till I call ‘em home.
